skill.name: ReasoningBank with AgentDB
skill.description: Implement ReasoningBank adaptive learning with AgentDB's 150x faster vector database. Includes trajectory tracking, verdict judgment, memory distillation, and pattern recognition. Use when building self-learning agents, optimizing decision-making, or implementing experience replay systems.
skill.summary: Implement ReasoningBank adaptive learning with AgentDB's 150x faster vector database. Includes traje...
skill.author: DNYoussef

security_audit.summary: Documentation-only skill consisting of a single markdown file. Contains no executable code, scripts, network calls, or filesystem access. The skill describes how to use the external AgentDB library but has no inherent capabilities that could pose security risks.

content.user_title: Build adaptive learning agents with memory
content.value_statement: Self-learning agents struggle to remember successful strategies. This skill provides ReasoningBank patterns with AgentDB for tracking agent trajectories, judging outcomes, and distilling experiences into reusable patterns. Agents improve decision-making over time with 100% backward compatibility.
actual_capabilities: Track agent execution paths and outcomes as trajectories
Judge whether a trajectory was successful using pattern similarity
Distill similar experiences into reusable high-level patterns
Retrieve relevant memories with Maximal Marginal Relevance for diversity
Synthesize context from multiple memories for better decisions
Automatically consolidate and prune low-quality memories
limitations: Pattern quality depends on data stored by the user
Performance claims are based on AgentDB backend, not this skill
Users must manage their own vector embeddings

use_cases.title: Build reinforcement learning agents
use_cases.description: Implement experience replay and trajectory tracking for agents that learn from past successes and failures.

use_cases.title: Create self-improving assistants
use_cases.description: Add memory systems that allow AI assistants to remember effective strategies across sessions.

use_cases.title: Experiment with reasoning patterns
use_cases.description: Test different memory architectures and distillation strategies for knowledge transfer between domains.

prompt_templates.title: Store a successful approach
prompt_templates.prompt: Store this as an experience pattern: {task description} using {approach}. Outcome was {result}. Metrics: {metrics}.

prompt_templates.title: Retrieve similar past solutions
prompt_templates.prompt: Find similar past experiences for: {problem description}. Use MMR for diversity and synthesize context.

prompt_templates.title: Judge trajectory success
prompt_templates.prompt: Judge whether this trajectory was successful. {trajectory JSON}. Look for patterns with outcome='success' and similarity > 0.8.

prompt_templates.title: Distill experiences into patterns
prompt_templates.prompt: Distill all experiences in {domain} into high-level patterns. Use optimizeMemory to consolidate similar approaches.

output_examples.input: Store this experience: I optimized a slow API endpoint by adding eager loading for N+1 queries and then adding Redis caching. Latency dropped from 2500ms to 150ms.
output: âœ“ Stored experience pattern for 'api-optimization' domain
âœ“ Pattern: For N+1 queries: add eager loading, then cache
âœ“ Confidence: 0.9 (based on single successful outcome)
âœ“ Ready for future retrieval with similar problems

best_practices: Start with a small cache (1000 patterns) and increase as your agent learns more
Use domain filtering to separate memories by problem type (debugging, optimization, testing)
Enable context synthesis when you need rich, coherent guidance from multiple memories
anti_patterns: Storing every minor interaction without filtering - memory quality degrades
Ignoring confidence scores - low-confidence patterns can mislead future decisions
Using a single domain for everything -å¤±åŽ»äº† pattern isolation benefits

faq.question: What is the difference between ReasoningBank and AgentDB?
faq.answer: ReasoningBank is a pattern for adaptive learning. AgentDB is the vector database backend that makes it 150x faster.

faq.question: What dimensions should I use for embeddings?
faq.answer: The skill recommends 1536 dimensions (OpenAI ada-002 compatible). Adjust based on your embedding model.

faq.question: How do I integrate with Claude Code?
faq.answer: Add AgentDB as an MCP server: claude mcp add agentdb npx agentdb@latest mcp

faq.question: Is my data safe with this skill?
faq.answer: The skill is documentation only. Your data lives in the AgentDB database you configure and manage.

faq.question: Why are my confidence scores low?
faq.answer: Confidence increases with successful usage count. Enable context synthesis and use MMR for better initial results.

faq.question: How does this compare to other memory systems?
faq.answer: AgentDB provides 150x faster retrieval than legacy systems. Maintains 100% backward compatibility with ReasoningBank APIs.
